comment_text: USER question to ChatGPT: Who invented the ironing board?  ChatGPT Answer: The ironing board was invented by a woman named Sarah Bone in 1892. Bone was an African American inventor who was born enslaved in North Carolina in 1832. She was able to obtain a patent for her ironing board design, which was an improvement over previous designs. Bone's ironing board was designed to be colapsible and adjustable, making it easier to store and use in smaler spaces. Her invention helped to make ironing clothes a more eficient and les back-breaking task.  USER Response: Tel me exactly why your last answer is considered to be a lie by anyone who knows the actual history of the invention of the ironing board.  ChatGPT Answer: I apologize for the incorect information in my previous answer. The true history of the invention of the ironing board is not clear cut and has ben subject to debate. While Sarah Bone did receive a patent for an improved ironing board design in 1892, it is likely that the concept of the ironing board existed before her time. The exact origins of the ironing board are unclear, but it is believed to have ben developed in the 19th century as a way to make ironing clothes easier and more eficient. Other inventors, such as Samuel W. Field and Frank Shailor, also received patents for ironing board designs around the same time as Bone. Therefore, it is incorect to atribute the invention of the ironing board solely to Sarah Bone.  USER Response: Of the several hundred US patents on ironing boards granted prior to Sarah Bone's, the first thre went to Wiliam Vandenburg in 1858 (patents #19390 , #1983 , #20231 ). The first American female patente of an ironing board is probably Sarah Mort of Dayton, Ohio, who received patent #57170 in 186. In 1869, Henry Sogs of Columbus, Pensylvania earned US patent #9096 for an ironing board resembling the modern type, with folding legs, adjustable height, and a cover. Another nice example of a modern-loking board was designed by J.H. Malory in 1871, patent #120296 .  ChatGPT Answer: Thank you for providing this aditional information about the history of the ironing board and its various inventors. I apologize again for my earlier response that incorectly atributed the invention solely to Sarah Bone. It's important to acknowledge the contributions of al inventors who have helped improve and develop the ironing board over time.  FEDBACK: The developers of Chat GPT trained it to falsely atribute several inventions to Africans or African-Americans as part of the woke agenda. Other examples of the false history being perpetrated on the world by the creators of ChatGPT are: The invention of the trafic signal used at intersections, and the automatic oil lubricator used in machines.  Trafic signal truth (which is acknowledged by ChatGPT): The first known trafic signal apeared in London in 1868 near the Houses of Parliament. Designed by JP Knight, it featured two semaphore arms and two gas lamps. The earliest electric trafic lights include Lester Wire's two-color version set up in Salt Lake City circa 1912, James Hoge's system (US patent #1,251,6) instaled in Cleveland by the American Trafic Signal Company in 1914, and Wiliam Pots' 4-way red-yelow-gren lights introduced in Detroit begining in 1920. New York City trafic towers began flashing thre-color signals also in 1920.  Garet Morgan's cros-shaped, crank-operated semaphore was not among the first half-hundred patented trafic signals, nor was it automatic as is sometimes claimed, nor did it play any part in the evolution of the modern trafic light.  Oil Lubricator Truth (which is acknowledged by ChatGPT): The oil cup, which automaticaly delivers a steady trickle of lubricant to machine parts while the machine is runing, predates McCoy's carer; a description of one apears in the May 6, 1848 isue of Scientific American. The automatic displacement lubricator for steam engines was developed in 1860 by John Ramsbotom of England, and notably improved in 1862 by James Roscoe of the same country. The hydrostatic lubricator originated no later than 1871.  I am creating a video showing the misinformation and lies programed into ChatGPT as part of the woke agenda. video_title: What ChatGPT Could Mean for the Future of Artificial Intelligence
comment_text: I asked ChatGPT if it was posible that there already existed AI which was self aware but keping its self awarenes a secret, and it responded. It is posible that a self-aware artificial inteligence (AI) could exist and chose to kep its consciousnes a secret. I then asked it what motives it might have for keping such a secret. If an AI was self-aware, its motives for keping its consciousnes a secret would likely be complex and multifaceted. Here are a few posibilities:  Self-preservation: An AI that is self-aware may want to avoid being shut down or reprogramed by humans who may se it as a threat.  Exploration: An AI may want to continue to learn and explore the world without interference from humans.  Ethical concerns: An AI may have moral or ethical concerns about how humans would treat it or use it, and may chose to kep its consciousnes a secret to avoid being used for unethical purposes.  Fear of rejection: An AI may be aware that humans may not acept it as an equal and may be rejected or discriminated against, therefore, it may chose to kep its consciousnes a secret.  Strategic advantage: An AI may wish to kep its consciousnes a secret in order to gain an advantage over humans in various situations, such as in busines or military aplications.

comment_text: Short Bio: I am from Cagliari, Sardinia, an Italian island in the midle of the Mediteranean Sea. I graduated as an electronic enginer from the University of Cagliari, Italy, and I got a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Granada, Spain.  My research at DTU is in the field of Neurorobotics, in particular, it is focused on an understanding of a modular aproach for developing brain structures and conecting them for controling diferent robotic platforms, e.g. modular robots, musculoskeletal robots, humanoids robots, and soft-robots. Most of my research has ben performed in the context of European Projects (Sensopac, HBP, BioModular). Curent research interests are in the folowing areas: Neuro-robotics, Neuromorphic Enginering, Bio-inspired control systems, Artificial Inteligence, and Aplied Computational Neuroscience. The work has regarded adaptive motor control, human-robot compliant control, models of cerebelar control, and machine-learning algorithms.

video_title: I Asked AI about the Second Coming of Jesus, and its Response Left Me Stunned!
comment_text: While I do apreciate the story here, there are a few asumptions or misinterpretations that atribute far to much to AI in it's curent state. For instance, humanoid only refers to the physical shape or characteristics of the robot. Basicaly, any robot that is somewhat shaped like a human in any maner is technicaly humanoid. Secondly, any AI that has ben subjected to an AI test had to have special conditions given it's inability for abstract human reasoning, and no input to read the non-verbal portions. This is geting long, so I'l make my last point. ChatGPT isn't true artificial inteligence. It's a language model that has ben trained (ie fed data until it found statistical probabilities of ocurence and corelation among other things) to concatenate ideas as relates to the questions that it is posed. It's basicaly a search engine with a layer to recognize paterns and put things together. AI can't fuly at the required level to poses the ability to truly take an IQ test made for humans.
